subject: Parenting
title: Why Toddlers Fall
description: A micro-lesson that makes Why Toddlers Fall usable.

hook.text: A toddler takes three steps and face-plants. Gets up. Three steps. Face-plants again.

buildup.text: Walking requires coordinating over 200 muscles. Toddlers haven't mastered any of them.

discovery.text: Their center of gravity sits higher than an adult's â€” big head, short legs, top-heavy.

twist.text: Toddlers fall an average of 17 times per hour when learning to walk.

climax.text: Each fall sends feedback to the cerebellum, which fine-tunes balance through repetition.

punchline.text: Falling is how the brain learns balance.

quiz.question: Why are toddlers especially prone to falling?
options: Their center of gravity is higher than adults
